intro: Thelypteris noveboracensis f. excurrens, commonly known as the New York maidenhair fern, is a fern species native to eastern North America. It belongs to the family Athyriaceae and is characterized by its delicate, lace-like fronds. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its rhizomes are creeping and produce a dense network of roots, aiding in its ability to thrive in humid conditions. The fronds are bi-lobed and have a distinctive, arching appearance, making it a popular ornamental plant.
